author: konmaorg
title: No Code Smart Contract Indexer
description: To visualize real time data on a Smart Contract it is not quite easy. It requires Tech Knowledge on how to fetch data, store them and keep getting them updated and costs a lot for the business.

author: konmaorg
title: KodeKlash Hackathon
description: Although Cardano has risen up to an established smart contract platform, the free developer cohort is still lagging behind. there is lack of awareness on haskells capabilities to the web3 ecosystem.

author: ninhtran
title: OpenSource MetaMask<=>₳ Integration
description: Metamask is the most popular Web3 wallet and Cardano dApps don't have an easy and an Open-Source plug-in that they can easily add to their website to receive, send, and fund user activities using ETH.

author: al.kc
title: Making developers into businesses
description: Most tech entrepreneurs are skilled in development but not business startup or growth, and need support to get from funding to flying – getting money in and products out

author: wada
title: Wada Academy for Haskell Devs
description: There is a shortage of online courses targeted at Haskell developers with a focus on building with Cardano.

author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Plutarch v2
description: Plutarch v1 greatly reduces the requirements of implementing stateful dApps (DeFi). Yet, expanded functionality is needed for Cardano devs/auditors to fully leverage the dramatic gains of this eDSL.

author: fimi.vn
title: Blockchain Course for Vietnam Devs
description: The majority of developers in Vietnam are not familiar with blockchain or are not right understand of blockchain and its importance roles to the real world.

author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Apropos for Property Tests
description: Property tests help ensure mission-critical dApps don’t contain vulnerabilities. However, writing tests to check every contract permutation and edge-case state is exhausting if not wholly impossible.

author: fimi.vn
title: Marlowe Course for Vietnam Devs
description: Developers in Vietnam are difficulty with Haskell, and Plutus programming languages, so it is challenging to start with building an application that integrates with Blockchain Cardano.

author: michele.nuzzi
title: plu-ts Typescript smart-contracts
description: Currently smart contract creation is limited to the haskell programming language; limiting potential of smart contracts that do need to be created on-the-fly by a PAB

author: fimi.vn
title: Plutus Video Sub for Vietnam Devs
description: The scarcity of documentation on the Plutus programming language in Vietnamese makes it difficult for talented developers in Vietnam to access Cardano's resources.

author: michele.nuzzi
title: (plu-ts) full Typescript off-chain
description: at the moment few options are available to write off-chain code, all with important drawbacks, and none supporting ts (or js) directly, which in many cases higher the learning curve.

author: alexis.hernandez
title: Enable any webapps to use PRISM
description:
There is a lot of interest in Atala PRISM becoming mainstream, but there is no simple way to use PRISM on the web
A lot of work is required for any web app to integrate PRISM, discouraging most devs

author: klarkc
title: Pure-Vue: Vue to PureScript bridge
description: The entry barrier to build quality dapps on Cardano is high, one of the reasons are the missing of familiar frameworks for majority of the web-developers.

author: tadatek
title: Rewards for Community Contributors
description: There are a lot of people who are producing Cardano content in Vietnam. Why not merge ideas to have an official page contributed by the community

author: oliverross
title: Community Consensus Certifications
description: Currently it's hard to understand a developer's Cardano skills without being a skilled developer yourself. We need a certification framework to lower barriers for businesses to hire teams.

author: welshie
title: Developer Portal - Built on Cardano
description: There is no comprehensive library of the tools and educational resources available for developers looking to join Cardano.

author: manfo2021
title: Haskell-Plutus-Atala => French Devs
description: Plutus uses advanced notions of Haskell which added to the lack of material in French, makes it really difficult for the French Dev community to join the Cardano ecosystem hence learn Haskell-Plutus.

author: megan.dit
title: Katiopa women: The pioneers of DeFi
description: Women are the designers & implementers of local community-run DeFi solutions in the African context. There is a need to provide them with tools to translate all that knowledge onto the Blockchain.

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Course For Developers
description: There are many developers who really want to write smart contracts and build projects on Cardano. But Haskell is a big barrier for developers from comparative programming languages.

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Book Vietnamese Translation
description: Cardano's Smart Contract is built on Haskell. But there is no book or document about Haskell for developers in Vietnamese. It is a big barrier for developers in Vietnam to build Dapps on Cardano

author: quangtran
title: Vietnamese Haskell Course
description: Haskell is the base programing language of Cardano's Smart Contracts. A lot of developers are very interested in building projects on Cardano but there are not any Haskell courses in Vietnamese

author: highlander
title: Smart Contract Library - Phase 1
description: Cardano lacks an open source library of smart contracts that developers can use for rapid prototyping.

author: playermint
title: FT Smart Contracts for Marketplaces
description:
NFTs are driving user engagement and adoption of Cardano, yet the only asset being used to facilitate these trades is ADA.
This leaves a gap in utility for the fungible tokens of Cardano.

author: antoine
title: Cardano Learn to Earn for Devs
description: The learning curve for Cardano Developers is very steep. Many want to learn but are severely limited by time, resources, and willpower.

author: tienna
title: Cardano developer club in Uni
description: IT students - developer resources are currently lacking an environment (Lab, exercise, reference document, hackathon..) to practice and experience building dApps on the blockchain platform

author: calexander
title: ADA Web3 Wallet Integration Package
description: At the moment, there is no convenient package that developers on Cardano can use to integrate their dApp with the various browser-based ADA wallets.

author: seirayun
title: Decentralized Escrow for Remote Job
description: Direct contracts between employers and remote developers may lead to disputes. However, centralized escrow services can be expensive and their decisions may be arbitrary. 日本語

author: matthalloran8
title: Open Standards Library
description: Metadata standards are an important aspect of smart contract development, yet there is no easy way to use or design them.

author: matthalloran8
title: Open Smart Contract Library
description: Many developers like learning from examples, but they are hard to find for Plutus smart contracts.

author: jaitnez
title: Learn-to-Earn Open Source Tooling
description: Currently there are no Plutus Smart Contract references or blueprints for eLearning platforms seeking to implement Learn2Earn mechanics using Blockchain.

author: alonsovillegas816
title: (cardano-go) A Golang package
description: There is no a comprehensive Go package to help developers build on Cardano.

author: ayaxlabombarda
title: Catalyst Dashboard Innovatio Tribe
description: Catalyst members do not have many spaces to discuss timely issues that arise in each fund, such as receiving feedback on proposals, finding potential collaborations or how to address challenges.

author: rcmorano
title: Dandelion Community Service
description: Deploying and maintaining Cardano API services is a challenging task to tackle for newcomers and small teams that want to try, prototype and build on Cardano.

author: guildoperators
title: Koios Extensions - Utilities, Bots
description: Blockchain data often requires similar tasks among builders leading to duplicated work. Meanwhile, the end-users struggle to query complete raw data from the blockchain.

author: shirogat
title: More Developers on Cardano
description: The developer community in East Africa still needs to be built, incentivized and motivated to build on Cardano.

author: atlanter
title: Scalus – Scala to Plutus compiler
description:
Writing DApps in Haskell has some drawbacks: 

hard to hire talent
slow compilation
no debugger
poor IDE support
can't compile to JavaScript, because GHCJS barely ever works, producing huge JS sources

author: otaviolima
title: Keeping Up with Cardano: 100 videos
description: People find it difficult to understand the potential of projects by reading whitepapers and websites, with unfriendly technical terms used. The terms used are very technical and not easy to access.

author: sbpabon
title: GIMBALABS TREASURY FOR TUTORS
description: Members of Gimbalabs are offering mentoring services to new students without financial recognition for their hours of work.

author: keith
title: Smart Contract Job Facilitation
description: There is usually very little trust between parties when a working agreement is initially started.

author: thiago.ouros
title: Attracting New Developers
description: Developers are unaware of the possibility of being remunerated by a decentralized fund. Besides, they are not being motivated to engage in an ecosystem where their code can also have social impact.

author: alfred.pham
title: WALLET ADD-ONS FOR GAME ENGINE
description: There is no wallet add-on for the game engine client in Cardano that suits the requirement of Miverse in long-term development.

author: ruben.ruiz
title: Cardano Code Camp - Pay To Learn
description: The current Cardano developer training experience is sub-par fragmented, & incomplete. There is currently no central hub or process for aspiring Cardano developers to go.

author: projectnewm
title: Kogmios Open Source Doc/Dev/Support
description: There exists a limiting number of ways to interact directly with the Cardano blockchain in a high-performance way.

author: tienna
title: Cardano developer courseware in Uni
description: University students are the future developer of blockchain but these developers can't afford formal basic and blockchain programming courses.

author: megan.dit
title: Cardano Stand @ PROMOTE Conf 2024
description: Cardano is missing a great opportunity to gain exposure at a high profile developers and entrepreneurs event happening in Cameroon every two years and involving 700+ enterprises from all sectors.

author: parduseidolon
title: Learning token engineering elements
description: Tokens let you design economic systems with complex incentives but understanding how to engineer these systems is shrouded in mathematics.

author: astroboysoup
title: CardanoPress: Docs for the Builders
description: Not everyone is an experienced developer that can pick up code to start building, but we are seeing more projects entering the space at this level of experience. Docs and tutorials will help!

author: otaviolima
title: Crypto Blockchain Talents Platform
description: Where to find and contact talents and professionals with high technical skills in blockchain, DeFi, Crypto, Web3, Smart Contracts, NFTs, Metaverse and many programming languages used in blockchain.

author: oshomah
title: Plutus for Nigerian Universities
description: Nigerian computer science degrees fall short of the requirements to solve current blockchain problems. An opportunity for a solution arises.

author: nielstron
title: Imperator - Secure, Imperative SCs
description: Many programmers are unfamiliar with functional programming languages like Haskell/Plutus. Program analysis tools focus on imperative languages. Let's develop a secure, imperative SC language!

author: proofspace.nick
title: App-to-Cardano Wallet Open Protocol
description: No way for mobile apps to sign transactions with some datum without entering a private key (which is not user-friendly and insecure).

author: bigbenbeer
title: UTXO Optimizer and Scheduler
description: Concurrency with UTXOs is a tricky problem that is difficult to solve and adds to transaction load unnecessarily.

author: juliane
title: Empower thru Project Based Learning
description: There are not enough project based learning (PBL) formats available for DEVs to become blockchain DEVs and deliver on the work ahead.

author: jackie
title: Dev-focused Learn-and-Earn Quests
description: There is a shortage of developers developing on Cardano globally, specifically Asia, and there is still a lot of room for improvement in top-level developer acquisition for the Cardano ecosystem.

author: jackie
title: Virtual Hackathon for Dev Education
description: There is a shortage of developers developing on Cardano globally, specifically the Asian region, and there is still a lot of room for builders to build products in the Cardano ecosystem.

author: sebastiengllmt
title: Fast reindexable data format
description: Currently no efficient tooling exists for storing the blocks persistently with fast indexing and fast distribution. For example, an empty indexer on Oura will still take ~300s/epoch

author: sebastiengllmt
title: Rust SDK fix critical CBOR encoding
description: Cardano uses a encoding scheme called CBOR that supports multiple ways of encoding the same data. No Rust library supports all possible encodings of data which has caused multiple critical issues

author: sebastiengllmt
title: Carp over-budget + maintenance
description: Carp is a more flexible alternative to the cardano-db-sync tool that was created as the result of a previously funded Catalyst proposal. However, it ended up being over-budget

author: sebastiengllmt
title: cip25 (NFT) Rust & WASM library
description: CIP25, the NFT standard for Cardano, currently does not have an open source Rust, WASM or Typescript library to parse the on-chain metadata. Instead, users simply use a JSON representation of its data

author: sebastiengllmt
title: Cardano Wallet OneBox
description: Currently, if you want to deploy your own light wallet or similar application, there is no single tool that you can use. Instead, you can have to figure out how to deploy and combine multiple tools

author: individuodigital1
title: Developers Hackaton Stories
description: The Cardano community through his developers is transforming the world and yet the world is still largely unaware. Much of the work we are doing is still unseen outside of the Cardano community.

author: rootsid
title: RootsId Verifiable Credential
description: Verifiable Credentials are a key component for interoperability across Self Sovereign Identity systems, within Cardano and abroad. However, ATALA Prism does not define any specific VC format.

author: gauthierlamothe
title: Glow on the PAB
description:
Cardano lacks a smooth Dev-experience: some tools are powerful, but very hard to use.
Hence, Cardano's not fueled by the countless people with good ideas but average DApp-development skills...

author: sbpabon
title: LATAM TRANSLATION HOUSE
description: Access to Cardano for 600 million people is not improved if LATAM members in the Catalyst ecosystem are not well served with fast and reliable access to Catalyst documentation in their own language.

author: essbante
title: WAL-API Identity Wallet Service
description: WAL-CLI is a great tool, but it can be of greater utility for the developer community if it is expanded into an Identity wallet API service.

author: fimi.vn
title: CatalystTalk: Grow Vietnamese Devs
description: Vietnam has a team of potential developers and lots of ideas. However, many ideas remain unrealized due to a lack of funds to implement and a lack of accessibility and understanding of Catalyst.

author: otaviolima
title: Track Wallets: Notify Mint/Buy NFTs
description: Difficulty following, keeping up to date and tracking favorite wallet addresses with NFTs Minted, Bought and Sold on the Cardano blockchain in a simple way, in real time and receiving notifications.

author: rsmolarz
title: SToR Token - Web 3.0/smart contract
description:
•Commercial Real Estate is highly desired investment vehicle that lacks transparency and has a need for intermediaries
•There is no functioning trustless system to raise capital for self-storage

author: titan
title: Transaction Editor Hardware wallet
description: The transaction editor has no secure key management and key storage, all keys are on the filesystem. Users improvise safety by working on air-gapped machines.

author: samjeff
title: Cardapper - YouTube C-Dev Channel
description: No YouTube channel to consistently post Cardano Development Tutorials that new developers can watch and learn for free.

author: tigerview
title: MeetProposer-Bright Up Dev's Ideas
description: Many developers have high-value ideas but aren't good at building them or promoting them to the community, so their proposals don't receive high PA scores and are not being funded.

author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Dev Documentation Drive
description: In Cardano's growing ecosystem, we've seen an explosion of tools and techniques for building smart contracts. Developers can and will move much faster if equipped with excellent guides and examples.

author: jkoppel
title: Automated Bug-finding for Plutus
description: Double-satisfaction bugs, clone script attacks – the same vulnerabilities repeat in Plutus contracts. We will build a tool that automatically finds subtle instances of common bugs.

author: venomstyx
title: Unreal Engine on Cardano Community
description:
Unreal Developers desiring Cardano adoption are few & isolated.
Nowhere Unreal specific to share, resources, discuss tools, or engage with Community.

author: adapools.org
title: cexplorer.io - cardano explorer
description: Diversity and enough different and independent tools for developers is the basis for a successful chain. Web-explorers are one of basics.

author: marcosantos
title: Asset ScamList
description: Today, with more than 5,000,000 assets created on the cardano network, we also have a proliferation of copies, imitations that aim to deceive users.

author: nickyjacob
title: The Developer List
description:
It is hard to find

A senior developer who is open to mentor young developers
A developer who is open to do some development gigs for enterprises and startups

author: sirwolcott
title: Catalyst HeartBeat
description: Long form content requires too much time and energy to digest for Catalyst Contributors. Keeping up is NOT an option. Collaboration, Self-Marketing & Reach are of top priority to Proposing Projects.

author: catalystswarm
title: Catalyst Swarm Operations
description: The Catalyst Community needs open spaces to network, connect ideas and projects, and participate in Catalyst governance.

author: otaviolima
title: Exhibit Blockchain BIT in RIO 22 BR
description: Only a few Brazilian companies know Cardano as a main Blockchain. Difficulty in adopting Cardano (ADA) in the real business world and show use cases about the cardano ecosystem.

author: viperstakepool
title: Stake Pool Keys in libcardano
description: The Cardano ecosystem has a new C++ library that exposes Cardano to one of the largest developer communities; however, the library does not yet provide stake pool cryptographic functionalities.

author: joey.chessher
title: Community Managed Proposal System
description:
Developers have expressed the need to move from Idealscale to a Community Managed System.
Lack of API’s and fast access to all current Catalyst data inhibits innovation within our builder community.

author: chilestakepo
title: An open source book on Cardano
description: Comprehensive instructional resources on Plutus that don't require prior functional programming experience are limited and such resources are almost non-existent for Spanish speakers.

author: john.jackson
title: CardanoHTX Developer Hub
description: Houston is a major economic center with world class industries, major universities, and growing networks for Lighting and Ethereum but lacks a community for Cardano to support development.

author: gondlr
title: Developers Reward program DEV$
description: Developers are not incentivized to work with Cardano technology, there is no reward for choosing to focus on this technology. No monetary incentive compensation is offered to use Haskell and Plutus.

author: elraulito
title: CNFTacademy Genesis
description: It is hard for developers to find content up to date and material in order to learn step by step how to code in Cardano

author: titan
title: Transaction Editor post Vasil HF
description: The transaction editor supports the Alonzo Hard Fork yet with the newest features coming with Vasil it requires many updates.

author: ldev
title: RESTful wrapper for Plutus Offchain
description: Variations across tools like cardano-cli, serialization libs and Plutus, like in data serialization create difficulty when more than one is present in a dApp stack.

author: catalystswarm
title: Catalyst Swarm - After Town Hall
description: There is a lack of open community spaces which provide effective platforms for developers to meet and connect, to share ideas and to find collaborators.

author: hotspringfinder
title: Flutter SDK
description: Flutter is the fastest growing mobile app developer community but currently there's no Flutter library support in the Cardano ecosystem.

author: agocorona
title: Fix Web3 rabbit holes
description: Web3 can manage transactions decentralized without human intervention, but the computer infrastructure depends on human intervention for maintenance. This induces centralization

author: alkemy
title: RampUp Plutus Devs for Cardano
description: Cardano needs urgently new devs for Plutus, but teaching is just the beginning, a complete program with job placement is needed, specially for Catalyst funded proposals that lack resources.

author: wolfram.blockchain.labs
title: Haskell Integration in Wolfram Tech
description: At present, Wolfram Research does not have the capability to allow Haskell to directly integrate with Wolfram Language and technologies

author: viperstakepool
title: Automated Cardano Testing Pipeline
description: When a new version of the Cardano node is released, it is difficult for community members to run basic functional tests on the node in an automated fashion (e.g., transactions, stake pool operation).

author: seedstars
title: Accelerator: FT Challenge Startups
description:
200 companies applied to the FT x Cardano Challenge (F7) and a small % of the applications were supported

53 in the bootcamps
24 of the 53 participants to the 3-month accelerators beginning in August

author: harveypham
title: Cardano Node on AWS - Quick Start
description: A lot of individuals and organizations want to build a Cardano node themselves, but the problem is creating services, apps on AWS as network, server, security, and alert system, making the system HA.

author: seedstars
title: Accelerator: Cardano Startups
description: Developers in emerging markets who want to build on Cardano don't have the business skills necessary to build and scale their business. They also don't know that Cardano partners with accelerators.

author: udais
title: Add Senior Developers to Ecosystem
description: There is a shortage of qualified senior developers for Cardano Blockchain worldwide. India has 2 million Developers with only 0.25% on all the Blockchains.

author: boonetb
title: Play2Learn2Earn ADA Makerspace Game
description: Learning blockchain development is a lot of hard work, and many of the teaching resources are not fun. Causing people to give up or not try at all.

author: udais
title: Add Junior Developers to Ecosystem
description: There is a shortage of qualified developers for Cardano Blockchain worldwide. India has 2 million Developers with only 0.25% on all the Blockchains.

author: chilestakepo
title: Cardano e-Learning Platform
description: There is a demand for diverse developers in the Cardano ecosystem but a lack of free instructional content and learning platforms. Currently available resources are generally only offered in English.

author: patricklance13
title: Zero to Haskell: Pre-Plutus Program
description: According to Plutus Pioneer staff, a very low percentage of students succeed in the program. The stated reason for student dropout is a lack of Haskell foundational knowledge.

author: alessandro.konrad
title: Lucid - Developing the Easy Way
description: Cardano didn't have a friendly and easy-to-use library for building transactions, interacting with Plutus smart contracts, and building dApps; making it very difficult to attract developers.

author: muesliswap
title: Open analytics standard for DeFi
description: DeFi Apps don't follow a standard on how API endpoints providing application data should be structured. Developers are required to write customs analysis tools or develop Dapp specific connectors.

author: dao.coders
title: DAO-NET: Small Developer Funding
description: The bureaucratic overhead and long timelines of the Project Catalyst funding are significant hurdles to developers seeking to rapidly create apps requiring only small budgets.

author: joey.chessher
title: Technical Resource Pool
description: There is no Technical Resource Pool where Non-Programmers can access the Programming Talent needed for their proposals to be completed successfully.

author: santi
title: Dolos: Cardano “Data Node”
description: Nodes used exclusively as data source for client tools have different requirements than block producers / relays nodes. Many performance / cost optimizations are not currently possible.

author: mavster04
title: Python SDK to Build Health App
description: Building a health app in a blockchain has lots of challenges. Aside from compliance, security, & data privacy, one has to learn blockchain-specific programming language. This makes onboarding harder.

author: mavster04
title: Golang SDK to Build Health App
description: Building a health app in a blockchain has lots of challenges. Aside from compliance, security, & data privacy, one has to learn blockchain-specific programming language. This makes onboarding harder.

author: mavster04
title: Rust SDK to Build Health App
description: Building a health app in a blockchain has lots of challenges. Aside from compliance, security, & data privacy, one has to learn blockchain-specific programming language. This makes onboarding harder.

author: mavster04
title: Java SDK to Build Health App
description: Building a health app in a blockchain has lots of challenges. Aside from compliance, security, & data privacy, one has to learn blockchain-specific programming language. This makes onboarding harder.

author: lpmaho
title: MLabs - Cardano Throughput Solution
description: Cardano is a 3rd generation blockchain supporting expressive and secure smart contracts (DApps). Yet, as often noted, Cardano's eUTXO design poses challenges not least of which is txn throughput.

author: cardano4climate
title: Onboard Devs with Impactful Events
description: Full of ideas, skill, and talent, Cardano developers don't find meaningful projects and fruitful collaborations. The developer experience is solitary. World-changing, killer apps never Hello World.

author: thecatalystschool
title: Catalyst School Fund 10 Operations
description: Proposers, Assessors, Voters and other Catalyst members still struggle to understand how Catalyst works and how to play their roles.

author: fluxcap
title: Immigration Documents on Chain Pt.2
description: This is phase two of a Fund 8 project (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398633/comments/403972) that develops a working example that translate immigration documents to Atala/PRISM for compliance.

author: rvcas
title: Aiken: Smart Contract Toolchain
description: For most developers the Haskell syntax of Plutus is unpalatable or too unfamiliar to hit the ground running. Although Plutus is a great language, this causes enough friction to slow down developers.

author: santi
title: Oura v2
description: Adoption of the open-source project "Oura" has increased and new feature / issues are being requested. Extra development bandwidth is required to add new features and keep up with code maintenance.

author: piensalibremexico
title: Spend Less Time And Money
description: There's no sufficient data about how general public interacts with Cardano and what's their knowledge about the ecosystem in general, that makes teams spend time and money to get that data.

author: dconecrypto
title: DCOne Crypto for Developers
description: Developers need APIs, Webhooks, SDKs...etc to build their products on Cardano platform. We will provide them freely for app developers for quick access to integrate with the Cardano blockchain

author: ashisherc
title: Upgrade Cardano wallet js for Vasil
description: Typhonjs is a pure-js Cardano wallet library. With the impending Vasil hard fork, developers will need Vasil compatibility in order to create more efficient smart contracts and DApps.

author: jpg.store
title: Open Source Auctions Smart Contract
description: The Cardano space has been auctioning NFTs since March of 2021 using Discord and other escrow models. While these are easily replicable there is no publicly available smart contract for auctions.

author: loshadro
title: ADA and DRC's mobile money exchange
description:
So far no cryptocurrency offers a conversion to mobile money from the DRC
In the Congolese market, no cryptocurrency is used on the same footing as the mobile money of the place.

author: santi
title: Kelley: Cardano k8s Operators
description: Deploying and maintaining Cardano components on Kubernetes clusters is complex and requires a deep understanding of many configuration details.

author: fuixlabs
title: Emursive DApp (Metaverse) Builder
description: Immature tooling and platforms put building a custom metaverse that uses Plutus smart contracts to manage exchanges of value out of reach of small teams

author: mmahut
title: Plutus support for Golang SDK
description: Golang serialization library has been funded and completed in previous catalyst rounds. It support Byron and Shelley era, in order to attract developers we need to bring it up to date with Plutus.

author: researchfund
title: Challenge Teams Web Portal - CTWP
description: Challenge Team (CT) members cannot easily streamline the Proof of Life (POL) process, especially for new CT members to record updates in phases 1, 2 and 3 and fairness in payment claims over CT term.

author: nmkr
title: Unity Game Engine NFT Plugin
description: Cardano is not very accessible to Game Developers, there are barely any games running on Cardano and even less Game-Focused tools.

author: muesliswap
title: Off-chain SC interaction tooling
description: Cardano features many opportunities for the community to participate in on-chain protocols through off-chain components. There are no templates and easily approachable tutorials to develop such tools.

author: dag1
title: Rendering and Tokenomics Consultant
description: The ecosystem has many projects that require 3d rendering and tokenomics but without proper coordination, these integrations are difficult to achieve
